greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n into distinct parts >= 2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: sum(i>=0, i! * x^((i^2+3*i)/2) / prod(j=1..i, 1-x^j ) ). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 21 2006
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; local s; s:= i*(i+1)/2-1;
a:= proc(n) option remember; local l; l:= b(n$2);
mathematica: zip = With[{m = Max[Length[#1], Length[#2]]}, PadRight[#1, m] + PadRight[#2, m]]&; b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = With[{s = i*(i+1)/2-1}, If[n == 0, {1}, If[i<2 || n>s, {}, zip[ b[n, i-1], Join[{0}, If[i>n, {}, b[n-i, i - 1]]]]]]]; a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{l = b[n, n]}, Sum[l[[i]]*(i-1)!, {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 70}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 13 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_
